posts.author: Imber
posts.content:
Hey guys,

So I'm looking to make my first assassin. He will be pvp focused from RP value, but I also want something that won't kill me to level and is fairly versitile for PVE as well, but main focus will be RP PVP. I would prefer a human as far as race, but am flexible.

A little information about Arelith;

It is a level 30 capped world and one must take 3 levels consecutively of any new class. You are able to purchace gifts (Ie. +2 strength) At the cost of ECL. I do not care what my character's ECL will be so gifts are an option. Forgive me if I'm leaving anything out of here.

I would like a high DA DC, but if that screws with the build too much well I'm willing to be flexible. Oh HIPs occures at level 5 with shadow dancer now instead of level one on the Arelith server if that is put into the build.

(I am very flexible on this, please give me your suggestions)

THANKS!

This version is the superior AB/AC/stealth/detection design.  It is arranged to take advantage of the monk AB progression (i.e. kama) and wearing robes/no shield.

If you want to change to Human, all those elements will be reduced (re: loss of Small Stature).  As long as you get at least DEX 25 by Level 24, Epic Dodge will be available at earliest opportunity.  I suppose you can boost DEX enough with that gifting system to meet the prereqs using human.  With Human you will be able to max one more skill and have a pre-epic feat as well.  Your choice.  But this is the optimized build requested and will be better PvP than a human or elven version.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote:
Does Aielund work in an Arelith scenario? I'm confused...sorry
Kinda.  You'd need to expand the build to 35-38 levels, though.

@JethronXaris:
That invisibility method is pretty much a waste of time, though.  Buff Ultravision/cast Darkness (a Wiz 5-6 gets an extended version plus the indispellable assassin version).  Every hit within the shroud is automatically a sneak/death attack, unless vs. a true seer, then dispel their vision buff first before casting darkness.  If vs. a True Seeing skin (like a dragon), sneaks/DAs are impossible as they are vs. any crit immune.  But the converse is also true.  Any "seer" rogue/assassin/BG within the shroud will also get free sneaks/DAs against your assassin, so be forewarned, especially if they are attacking enmasse by range within 30 feet.  It can be very painful.

You need LOTS and LOTS of DA attempts because not every successful hit triggers a Fort save.   For that reason, it is best to steer away from high-CON foes else waste those rare save opportunities.

Thug/initiative feats are worthless outside of PnP where sneak attacks are not based on a myriad of other more significant factors that are part of the game.
